conversation.content: Hi, can I bring a pocket knife in my carry-on luggage?
Hello! Unfortunately, pocket knives are not allowed in carry-on luggage. You can pack them in your checked baggage instead.
What about a lighter? Can I carry that with me?
You can bring one lighter in your carry-on baggage, but it must be kept on your person. Please ensure it is a disposable or Zippo-type lighter.
Are there any restrictions on carrying liquids in my hand luggage?
Yes, liquids in your carry-on must be in containers of 100ml or less and fit in a single, transparent, resealable plastic bag not exceeding 1 liter. Each passenger is limited to one plastic bag.
Can I bring my medication in liquid form?
Yes, you can bring necessary medications in liquid form. Itâ€™s best to declare them at the security checkpoint. You may need to provide proof of prescription.
Thanks for the information!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. Safe travels!
Can I bring my own snacks on the plane?
Yes, you can bring your own snacks on the plane. Just make sure they comply with any local regulations regarding agricultural products if you're traveling internationally.
What about drinks? Can I bring a bottle of water?
You can bring an empty water bottle through security and fill it up after passing through. Liquids over 100ml are not allowed through security in your carry-on.
Are power banks allowed in my luggage?
Power banks are allowed, but they must be carried in your carry-on luggage, not in checked baggage. Also, ensure the power bank is within the airline's watt-hour limits.
Is there a limit to how many I can bring?
Yes, generally you can carry two power banks with a capacity between 100Wh and 160Wh, or as many as you need below 100Wh. Check with your specific airline for their policy.
Can I carry my drone with me on the flight?
You can bring a drone in your carry-on luggage, but it's best to check with your airline regarding their specific policies. Ensure the batteries are also carried in your hand luggage.
Are there any restrictions on the drone batteries?

Yes, drone batteries must be carried in your carry-on, and they should comply with the airline's watt-hour restrictions for lithium batteries. Typically, batteries under 100Wh are allowed without restrictions.
